main event: A large, silvery, disc-shaped object was sighted over Galveston, Texas on September 2, 1957.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be about 40-50 feet in diameter.
The object was observed moving rapidly, hovering, and making sudden changes in direction.
The object was observed for about 3-4 minutes before it disappeared.
The investigation revealed no physical evidence such as radar detection, independent witnesses, or unusual meteorological conditions.
The conclusion of the investigation was that the object remained unidentified.
